final_answer.precision_note: Given current and time are 3 s.f.; copper mass reported to 3 s.f.

method: Convert the time to seconds: 30.0 min × 60 = 1800 s. Charge passed equals current multiplied by time, so Q = 1.50 × 1800 = 2700 C. Using the Faraday constant F = 96,500 C mol−1, the moles of electrons are n(e−) = 2700/96500 = 0.02798 mol. The cathode half-equation Cu2+ + 2e− → Cu shows 2 mol electrons deposit 1 mol copper, so n(Cu) = 0.02798/2 = 0.01399 mol. Convert moles of copper to mass using Cu = 63.55 g mol−1: m(Cu) = 0.01399 × 63.55 = 0.889 g.
checks: The half-equation requires 2 electrons per copper atom, so deposited copper moles must be half the electron moles.
